text: Here's how to post multiple photos
on your Instagram story.

Tap the plus sign at the
top right on the screen.

On the bottom right, you'll
see options for posting.

Select "STORY." You have
two different options.
You can use Instagram's layout feature
to post multiple photos in a story.
You'll see an option to change your grid.
Take live photos.
Or swipe up to see your photo library.
Choose a photo for each section.

You can adjust the picture
by using two fingers
to move it around.
You can delete a photo off the grid

by tapping the photo and
hitting the trash-can icon.

The other way lets you
post a series of photos,
each a separate 15-second story.
On the story screen,
swipe up and tap "SELECT MULTIPLE."
Choose the photos you want.
When you hit "NEXT," you have the option

of adding filters, text,
drawings, links, or stickers.
To post the 24-hour story, tap "Share."
